intro: Pedicularis cadmea, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from purple to pink, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
